examples: // Use a 50Hz filter instead of the default 60Hz.
// Treat value spikes (20°C delta in under 1s) as read errors.
// Read faster and more often than 1-shot; bias voltage always on; slight effect on RTD temperature.
// Enable a fan on the chamber
// Enable a servo-controlled vent on the chamber
// Enable a fan on the cooler, Fan# 0,1,2,3 etc.

fanOffPwm.notes: Some coolers may require a non-zero "off" state.

examples: // Increase the fan PWM frequency. Removes the PWM noise but increases heating in the FET/Arduino
// Needed with AUTO_FAN when 4-wire PWM fans are installed
// Disable brightness control. Enable for non-PWM lighting.
// Add Case Light options to the LCD menu
// Use NeoPixel LED as case light
// Use RGB / RGBW LED as case light
// Enable Z the last moment. Needed if your Z driver overheats.

dualXCarriageMode.notes: NOTE: For Dual X Carriage use M218 T1 Xn to override the X2_HOME_POS. This allows recalibration of endstops distance without a rebuild. Remember to set the second extruder's X-offset to 0 in your slicer. This is the default power-up mode which can be changed later using M605 S<mode>.

duplicationXOffset.notes: Default x offset in duplication mode (typically set to half print bed width)

eventGcodeIdexAfterModechange.notes: Default action to execute following M605 mode change commands. Typically G28X to apply new mode.

examples: // X2 direction signal is the opposite of X
// Y2 direction signal is the opposite of Y
// Z2 direction signal is the opposite of Z
// Z3 direction signal is the opposite of Z
// Z4 direction signal is the opposite of Z

eDualStepperDrivers.notes: Drive the E axis with two synchronized steppers

extSolenoid.notes: @section extruder Activate a solenoid on the active extruder with M380. Disable all with M381. Define SOL0_PIN, SOL1_PIN, etc., for each extruder that has a solenoid.

examples: // If G28 contains XY do a diagonal move first
// If X/Y can't home without homing Y/X first

zStepperAlignAmp.notes: Amplification factor. Used to scale the correction step up or down in case the stepper (spindle) position is farther out than the test point.

g34MaxGrade.notes: On a 300mm bed a 5% grade would give a misalignment of ~1.5cm

assistedTramming.notes: Add the G35 command to read bed corners to help adjust screws. Requires a bed probe.

trammingPointXy.notes: Define from 3 to 9 points to probe.

trammingPointName1.notes: Define position names for probe points.

examples: // Report Z deviation (mm) for each point relative to the first
// Add a Tramming Wizard to the LCD menu
// Add a menu to the LCD to set shaping parameters.

multiNozzleDuplication.notes: Add a Duplicate option for well-separated conjoined nozzles

invertXStepPin.notes: By default pololu step drivers require an active high signal. However, some high power drivers require an active low signal as step.

examples: // Disable if the nozzle could fall onto your printed part!

minsegmenttime.notes: Minimum time that a segment needs to take as the buffer gets emptied

slowdown.notes: Slow down the machine if the lookahead buffer is (by default) half full. Increase the slowdown divisor for larger buffer sizes.

minimumPlannerSpeed.notes: Minimum planner junction speed. Sets the default minimum speed the planner plans for at the end of the buffer and all stops. This should not be much greater than zero and should only be changed if unwanted behavior is observed on a user's machine when running at very slow speeds.

backlashCompensation.notes: Backlash Compensation Adds extra movement to axes on direction-changes to account for backlash.

backlashDistanceMm.notes: Define values for backlash distance and correction. If BACKLASH_GCODE is enabled these values are the defaults.

coreBacklash.notes: Add steps for motor direction changes on CORE kinematics

backlashSmoothingMm.notes: Set BACKLASH_SMOOTHING_MM to spread backlash correction over multiple segments to reduce print artifacts. (Enabling this is costly in memory and computation!)

backlashGcode.notes: Add runtime configuration and tuning of backlash values (M425)

measureBacklashWhenProbing.notes: Measure the Z backlash when probing (G29) and set with "M425 Z"

backlashMeasurementLimit.notes: When measuring, the probe will move up to BACKLASH_MEASUREMENT_LIMIT mm away from point of contact in BACKLASH_MEASUREMENT_RESOLUTION increments while checking for the contact to be broken.

calibrationNozzleTipHeight.notes: The following parameters refer to the conical section of the nozzle tip.

calibrationReporting.notes: Uncomment to enable reporting (required for "G425 V", but consumes flash).

calibrationObjectCenter.notes: The true location and dimension the cube/bolt/washer on the bed.

calibrationMeasureRight.notes: Comment out any sides which are unreachable by the probe. For best auto-calibration results, all sides must be reachable.

calibrationMeasureAtTopEdges.notes: Probing at the exact top center only works if the center is flat. If probing on a screw head or hollow washer, probe near the edges.

microstepModes.notes: Microstep settings (Requires a board with pins named X_MS1, X_MS2, etc.)

digipotI2cMotorCurrents.notes: Actual motor currents in Amps. The number of entries must match DIGIPOT_I2C_NUM_CHANNELS. These correspond to the physical drivers, so be mindful if the order is changed.

examples: // Use DIGIPOT_MOTOR_CURRENT raw wiper values (instead of A4988 motor currents)
// Encoder sets the feedrate multiplier on the Status Screen

encoderRateMultiplier.notes: Change values more rapidly when the encoder is rotated faster

xAxisTwistCompensation.notes: Add calibration in the Probe Offsets menu to compensate for X-axis twist.

turboBackMenuItem.notes: BACK menu items keep the highlight at the top

examples: // Add a mute option to the LCD menu
// Show a smaller Marlin logo on the Boot Screen (saving lots of flash)

statusMessageScrolling.notes: Scroll a longer status message into view

statusMessageTimeoutSec.notes: Apply a timeout to low-priority status messages

examples: // Enable the Preset Color menu option
// Enable a second NeoPixel Preset Color menu option
// Have the printer display the user preset color on startup
// Have the printer display the user preset color on startup for the second strip

setProgressManually.notes: Add 'M73' to set print job progress, overrides Marlin's built-in estimate

examples: // Add 'P' parameter to set percentage done
// Add 'R' parameter to set remaining time
// Add 'C' parameter to set time until next filament change or other user interaction
// Show print progress percentage (doesn't affect progress bar)
// Display time until next user interaction ('C' = filament change)
// Show/report progress with decimal digits, not all UIs support this
// Show the message for MSG_TIME then clear it
// Read-only SD card (to save over 2K of flash)
// Enable G-code M808 to set repeat markers and do looping

sdcardRatherrecentfirst.notes: Reverse SD sort to show "more recent" files first, according to the card's FAT. Since the FAT gets out of order with usage, SDCARD_SORT_ALPHA is recommended.

examples: // Add a menu option to run auto#.g files
// Open the file browser when media is inserted
// Force the media menu to be listed on the top of the main menu
// Backup power / UPS to move the steppers on power loss
// Set pullup / pulldown as appropriate for your sensor

powerLossMinZChange.notes: Without a POWER_LOSS_PIN the following option helps reduce wear on the SD card, especially with "vase mode" printing. Set too high and vases cannot be continued.

powerLossRecoverZhome.notes: Enable if Z homing is needed for proper recovery. 99.9% of the time this should be disabled!

utfFilenameSupport.notes: Allow international symbols in long filenames. To display correctly, the LCD's font must contain the characters. Check your selected LCD language.

examples: // Get the long filename of a file/folder with 'M33 <dosname>' and list long filenames with 'M20 L'
// Create / delete files with long filenames via M28, M30, and Binary Transfer Protocol
// Include timestamps by adding the 'T' flag to M20 commands
// Scroll long filenames in the SD card menu

binaryFileTransfer.notes: Add an optimized binary file transfer mode, initiated with 'M28 B1'

customFirmwareUpload.notes: Include extra facilities (e.g., 'M20 F') supporting firmware upload via BINARY_FILE_TRANSFER

xyzNoFrame.notes: Save many cycles by drawing a hollow frame or no frame on the Info Screen

bigEditFont.notes: A bigger font is available for edit items. Costs 3120 bytes of flash. Western only. Not available for Cyrillic, Kana, Turkish, Greek, or Chinese.

smallInfofont.notes: A smaller font may be used on the Info Screen. Costs 2434 bytes of flash. Western only. Not available for Cyrillic, Kana, Turkish, Greek, or Chinese.

dogmSpiDelayUs.notes: Enable this option and reduce the value to optimize screen updates. The normal delay is 10µs. Use the lowest value that still gives a reliable display.

examples: // Use plain hotend icons instead of numbered ones (with 2+ hotends)
// Show solid nozzle bitmaps when heating (Requires STATUS_HOTEND_ANIM for numbered hotends)
// Use a second bitmap to indicate hotend heating
// Use a second bitmap to indicate chamber heating
// Use a second bitmap to indicate spindle / laser active
// Use a second bitmap to indicate laser cooling
// Use multiple bitmaps to indicate coolant flow
// Show heating in a progress bar
// Animated Marlin logo. Costs ~3260 (or ~940) bytes of flash.
// Add extra blank lines above the "Games" sub-menu
// Enable to save many cycles by drawing a hollow frame on Menu Screens
// Swap the CW/CCW indicators in the graphics overlay
// Fix Rx overrun situation (Currently only for AVR)
// Show a "waiting" screen between some screens

chironTftStandard.notes: By default the type of panel is automatically detected. Enable one of these options if you know the panel type.

acDefaultStartupTune.notes: Enable the longer Anycubic powerup startup tune

touchUi320x240.notes: Correct the resolution if not using the stock TFT panel.

aoExp1Pinmap.notes: Mappings for boards with a standard RepRapDiscount Display connector

touchUiInverted.notes: Display Orientation. An inverted (i.e. upside-down) display is supported on the FT800. The FT810 and beyond also support portrait and mirrored orientations.

touchUiUseUtf8.notes: UTF8 processing and rendering. Unsupported characters are shown as '?'.

touchUiUtf8WesternCharset.notes: Western accents support. These accented characters use combined bitmaps and require relatively little storage.

touchUiUtf8Superscripts.notes: Additional character groups. These characters require full bitmaps and take up considerable storage:

examples: // Æ Ð Ø Þ æ ð ø þ

touchUiUtf8CyrillicCharset.notes: Cyrillic character set, costs about 27KiB of flash

touchUiFitText.notes: Use a smaller font when labels don't fit buttons

touchUiPasscode.notes: Use a numeric passcode for "Screen lock" keypad. (recommended for smaller displays)

touchUiDebug.notes: Output extra debug info for Touch UI events

touchUiDeveloperMenu.notes: Developer menu (accessed by touching "About Printer" copyright text)

examples: // EXPERIMENTAL integration of babystepping into the Stepper ISR
// Allow babystepping at all times (not just during movement)
// Also enable X/Y Babystepping. Not supported on DELTA!
// Specify BABYSTEP_MULTIPLICATOR_(XY|Z) in mm instead of micro-steps
// Double-click on the Status Screen for Z Babystepping.
// Jump to the move Z menu on double-click when printer is idle.
moveZWhenIdle.notes: Note: Extra time may be added to mitigate controller latency.

examples: // For multiple hotends, babystep relative Z offsets
// Add a second linear advance constant, configurable with M900 L.
// Print debug information to serial during operation. Disable for production use.
// Allow I2S_STEPPER_STREAM to be used with LA. Performance degrades as the LA step rate reaches ~20kHz.
"M117 Probe failed. Rewiping.\nG28\nG12 P0 S12 T0"

"M117 Bed leveling failed.
G0 Z10
M300 P25 S880
M300 P50 S0
M300 P25 S880
M300 P50 S0
M300 P25 S880
M300 P50 S0
G4 S1"

ptcHotendStart.notes: Note: There is no automatic calibration for the hotend. Use M871.

ptcParkPos.notes: Park position to wait for probe cooldown

savedPositions.notes: @section extras  G60/G61 Position Save and Return

examples: // Enable the 'P' parameter to specify complete circles
// Enable only if using SkeinForge with "Arc Point" fillet procedure
// Allow G2/G3/G5 to operate in XY, ZX, or YZ planes

minStepsPerSegment.notes: @section motion Moves (or segments) with fewer steps than this will be joined with the next move

maxCmdSize.notes: @section serial The ASCII buffer for serial input

txBufferSize.notes: Transmission to Host Buffer Size To save 386 bytes of flash (and TX_BUFFER_SIZE+3 bytes of RAM) set to 0. To buffer a simple "ok" you need 4 bytes. For ADVANCED_OK (M105) you need 32 bytes. For debug-echo: 128 bytes for the optimal speed. Other output doesn't need to be that speedy. :[0, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256]

rxBufferSize.notes: Host Receive Buffer Size Without XON/XOFF flow control (see SERIAL_XON_XOFF below) 32 bytes should be enough. To use flow control, set this buffer size to at least 1024 bytes. :[0, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512, 1024, 2048]

serialXonXoff.notes: Enable to have the controller send XON/XOFF control characters to the host to signal the RX buffer is becoming full.

serialStatsMaxRxQueued.notes: Enable this option to collect and display the maximum RX queue usage after transferring a file to SD.

serialStatsDroppedRx.notes: Enable this option to collect and display the number of dropped bytes after a file transfer to SD.

rxBufferMonitor.notes: Monitor RX buffer usage Dump an error to the serial port if the serial receive buffer overflows. If you see these errors, increase the RX_BUFFER_SIZE value. Not supported on all platforms.

examples: // Auto-report the machine status like Grbl CNC

advancedOk.notes: Some clients will have this feature soon. This could make the NO_TIMEOUTS unnecessary.

serialOverrunProtection.notes: Printrun may have trouble receiving long strings all at once. This option inserts short delays between lines of serial output.

serialFloatPrecision.notes: For serial echo, the number of digits after the decimal point

examples: // Retract and restore all mixing steppers simultaneously

toolchangeZraise.notes: Z raise distance for tool-change, as needed for some extruders

examples: // Apply raise before swap retraction (if enabled)
// Never return to previous position on tool-change
// Always execute above G-code sequences. Use with caution!

toolchangeFsExtraPrime.notes: Longer prime to clean out a SINGLENOZZLE

toolchangeFsFan.notes: Cool after prime to reduce stringing

toolchangeFsSlowFirstPrime.notes: Use TOOLCHANGE_FS_PRIME_SPEED feedrate the first time each extruder is primed

filamentUnloadPurgeRetract.notes: Filament Unload does a Retract, Delay, and Purge first:

examples: // Enable for XYZ steppers to stay powered on during filament change.

// Reduce number of waits by not prompting again post-timeout before continuing.

// Add M701/M702 Load/Unload G-codes, plus Load/Unload in the LCD Prepare menu.

i2cMasterId.notes: @section i2cbus  I2C Master ID for LPC176x LCD and Digital Current control Does not apply to other peripherals based on the Wire library.

photoPosition.notes: A position to move to (and raise Z) before taking the photo

photographPin.notes: Canon RC-1 or homebrew digital camera trigger Data from: https://www.doc-diy.net/photo/rc-1_hacked/

photoSwitchPosition.notes: Optional second move with delay to trigger the camera shutter

photoSwitchMs.notes: Duration to hold the switch or keep CHDK_PIN high

i2cAmmeter.notes: Laser I2C Ammeter (High precision INA226 low/high side module)

customMenuConfig.notes: @section custom config menu Custom Menu: Configuration Menu

i2cpeEnc1TicksRev.notes: 1mm poles. For linear encoders this is ticks / mm, for rotary encoders this is ticks / revolution.

examples: // Invert the direction of axis travel.
i2cpeEnc1Invert.notes: steps per full revolution (motor steps/rev * microstepping)

i2cpeEnc2Addr.notes: printer will attempt to correct the error; errors smaller than this are ignored to minimize effects of measurement noise / latency (filter).

i2cpeDefType.notes: Default settings for encoders which are enabled, but without settings configured above.

i2cpeTimeTrusted.notes: axis after which the printer will abort. Comment out to disable abort behavior.

i2cpeErrRollingAverage.notes: Use a rolling average to identify persistent errors that indicate skips, as opposed to vibration and noise.

examples: // Enable if X direction is reversed
// Enable if Y direction is reversed
// Enable if Z direction is reversed

joyXLimits.notes: Use M119 with JOYSTICK_DEBUG to find reasonable values after connecting:

examples: // Enable to calibrate Z in the MIN direction

// The order of the LED matrix units may be reversed
max7219ReverseOrder.notes: connector at:  right=0   bottom=-90  top=90  left=180

examples: // The LEDs in each matrix unit row may be reversed

max7219DebugProfile.notes: If you experience stuttering, reboots, etc. this option can reveal how tweaks made to the configuration are affecting the printer in real-time.

examples: // Send a "Z_move_comp" report for any axis move (not just Z).
// Marlin embedded WiFi management. Not needed for simple WiFi serial port.

// Accept feature config commands (e.g., WiFi ESP3D) from the host

mmu2RstPin.notes: Use hardware reset for MMU if a pin is defined for it

mmu2Mode12v.notes: Enable if the MMU2 has 12V stepper motors (MMU2 Firmware 1.0.2 and up)

mmu2Menus.notes: Add an LCD menu for MMU2

mmu2FilamentchangeEjectFeed.notes: Settings for filament load / unload from the LCD menu. This is for Průša MK3-style extruders. Customize for your hardware.

examples: // Write debug info to serial output

serviceName1.notes: Activate up to 3 service interval watchdogs

m100FreeMemoryWatcher.notes: @section develop  M100 Free Memory Watcher to debug memory usage

pinsDebugging.notes: M43 - display pin status, toggle pins, watch pins, watch endstops & toggle LED, test servo probe

marlinTestBuild.notes: Enable Tests that will run at startup and produce a report

marlinDevMode.notes: Enable Marlin dev mode which adds some special commands

examples: // 'KILL' and '^X' commands will soft-reset the controller
// Use a digital button to soft-reset the controller after KILL

optibootResetReason.notes: Report uncleaned reset reason from register r2 instead of MCUSR. Supported by Optiboot on AVR.

examples: // Halt the printer if the board sensor leaves the temp range below.
// Don't slow fan speed during M303
// Detect a sensor malfunction preventing temperature updates

pidExtrusionScaling.notes: Add an additional term to the heater power, proportional to the extrusion speed. A well-chosen Kc value should add just enough power to melt the increased material volume.

pidFanScalingAtFullSpeed.notes: The alternative definition is used for an easier configuration. Just figure out Kf at full speed (255) and PID_FAN_SCALING_MIN_SPEED. DEFAULT_KF and PID_FAN_SCALING_LIN_FACTOR are calculated accordingly.

autotempProportional.notes: Turn on AUTOTEMP on M104/M109 by default using proportions set here

showTempAdcValues.notes: Show Temperature ADC value Enable for M105 to include ADC values read from temperature sensors.

maxConsecutiveLowTemperatureErrorAllowed.notes: The number of consecutive low temperature errors that can occur before a MINTEMP error is triggered. (Shouldn't be more than 10.)

preheatShortcutMenuItem.notes: Insert a menu for preheating at the top level to allow for quick access

examples: // Use combined heater images instead of separate ones
// Use a second bitmap to indicate bed heating
// Display a preheat screen during heatup

ptcBedStart.notes: Bed temperature calibration builds a similar table.

ptcProbeTemp.notes: The temperature the probe should be at while taking measurements during bed temperature calibration.

heatersParallel.notes: @section temperature Control heater 0 and heater 1 in parallel.

bltouchDelay.notes: Safety: The probe needs time to recognize the command. Minimum command delay (ms). Enable and increase if needed.

bltouchForceSwMode.notes: Feature: Switch into SW mode after a deploy. It makes the output pulse longer. Can be useful in special cases, like noisy or filtered input configurations.

examples: // Add a Probe Z Offset calibration option to the LCD menu

probeOffsetWizardXyPos.notes: Set a convenient position to do the calibration (probing point and nozzle/bed-distance)

probeDeployStowMenu.notes: Show Deploy / Stow Probe options in the Motion menu.

examples: // Enable graphical overlay on Z-offset editor

ptcProbeStart.notes: Probe temperature calibration generates a table of values starting at PTC_PROBE_START (e.g., 30), in steps of PTC_PROBE_RES (e.g., 5) with PTC_PROBE_COUNT (e.g., 10) samples.

ptcProbePos.notes: Probe position to probe and wait for probe to reach target temperature

ptcProbeHeatingOffset.notes: Height above Z=0.0 to raise the nozzle. Lowering this can help the probe to heat faster. Note: The Z=0.0 offset is determined by the probe Z offset (e.g., as set with M851 Z).

examples: // Include G38.4 and G38.5 to probe away from target
// Ignore SCK/MOSI/MISO pins; use CS and the default SPI bus.

tempSensorAd595Offset.notes: @section temperature Calibration for AD595 / AD8495 sensor to adjust temperature measurements. The final temperature is calculated as (measuredTemp * GAIN) + OFFSET.

examples: // With this option only the Z axis is considered
// Ignore Z stepper. Useful when stepper timeout is disabled.

controllerFanMinBoardTemp.notes: Use TEMP_SENSOR_BOARD as a trigger for enabling the controller fan

externalClosedLoopController.notes: Employ an external closed loop controller. Override pins here if needed.

bltouchLcdVoltageMenu.notes: Safety: Enable voltage mode settings in the LCD menu.

lcdInfoMenu.notes: Include a page of printer information in the LCD Main Menu

examples: // Show bootscreen(s) instead of Printer Info pages

lcdTimeoutToStatus.notes: The timeout to return to the status screen from sub-menus

lcdDecimalSmallXy.notes: On the Info Screen, display XY with one decimal place when possible

lcdShowETotal.notes: Show the E position (filament used) during printing

examples: // Show a progress bar on HD44780 LCDs for SD printing
// Add a menu item to test the progress bar
// Automatically save language to EEPROM on change

clcdModReset.notes: Pins for CS and MOD_RESET (PD) must be chosen

clcdUseSoftSpi.notes: If using software SPI, specify pins for SCLK, MOSI, MISO

examples: // Display total babysteps since last G28

filamentLcdDisplay.notes: Display filament width on the LCD status line. Status messages will expire after 5 seconds.

examples: // Slow part cooling fan if temperature drops

bezierCurveSupport.notes: G5 Bézier Curve Support with XYZE destination and IJPQ offsets

examples: // Purge continuously up to the purge length until interrupted.
advancedPauseContinuousPurge.notes: For Bowden, the full length of the tube and nozzle. For direct drive, the full length of the nozzle.

advancedPauseResumePrime.notes: Set to 0 for manual extrusion. Filament can be extruded repeatedly from the Filament Change menu until extrusion is consistent, and to purge old filament.

examples: // Turn off print-cooling fans while the machine is paused.

mmu2FilamentRunoutScript.notes: G-code to execute when MMU2 F.I.N.D.A. probe detects filament runout

endstopsAlwaysOnDefault.notes: @section endstops If you want endstops to stay on (by default) even when not homing enable this option. Override at any time with M120, M121.

examples: // Other Z axes have their own endstops
// If G28 contains XY home Y before X
// Home Z first. Requires a real endstop (not a probe).

homeAfterG34.notes: After G34, re-home Z (G28 Z) or just calculate it from the last probe heights? Re-homing might be more precise in reproducing the actual 'G28 Z' homing height, especially on an uneven bed.

examples: // If needed, home before parking for filament change
// Display extruder move distance rather than "position"
// Restore leveling after G34 is done?
// Enable to restore leveling setup after operation

meshMinX.notes: Override the mesh area if the automatic (max) area is too large

examples: // Store mesh with less precision to save EEPROM space

minimumfeedrate.notes: Default Minimum Feedrates for printing and travel moves

beepOnFeedrateChange.notes: Play a beep when the feedrate is changed from the Status Screen

examples: // Allow a DEFAULT_EJERK value of <10. Recommended for direct drive hotends.

filamentChangeUnloadFeedrate.notes: This short retract is done immediately, before parking the nozzle.

filamentChangeSlowLoadFeedrate.notes: For Bowden, the full length of the tube and nozzle. For direct drive, the full length of the nozzle. Set to 0 for manual unloading.

filamentChangeFastLoadFeedrate.notes: 0 to disable start loading and skip to fast load only

g0Feedrate.notes: Enable and set a (default) feedrate for all G0 moves

examples: // The G0 feedrate is set by F in G0 motion mode
// Report only when printing from SD

sdDetectState.notes: The standard SD detect circuit reads LOW when media is inserted and HIGH when empty. Enable this option and set to HIGH if your SD cards are incorrectly detected.

examples: // Don't mount the SD card when starting up
// Confirm the selected SD file before printing

// Disable USB Host access to USB Drive to prevent hangs on block access for DUE platform

noSdDetect.notes: Enable if SD detect is rendered useless (e.g., by using an SD extender)

examples: // Disable SD Card access over USB (for security).
// Allow M702 to unload all extruders above a minimum target temp (as set by M302)

mmu2SerialPort.notes: Serial port used for communication with MMU2.
